title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Questions are being raised about Prime Minister Scott Morrison's Pacific Infrastructure Bank, following reports approvals are yet to be made for any projects almost a year after it was announced. The Australian reports the Department of Foreign Affairs - which runs the bank - is '­assessing a range of infrastructure projects' - but has not disbursed any grants or loans. The Australian Infrastructure Financing Facility for the Pacific was announced last November and has been operating since July after concerns over China's rising influence in the region. Business leaders who previously endorsed the bank - are now calling on the government to be more transparent about the funds' operation. Image: News Corp Australia
